scenario_title: Repeated Unintentional Data Access and Request Due to Excessive Curiosity

why.details: Due to excessive curiosity and limited awareness of access boundaries, the user repeatedly accessed or requested confidential data unrelated to their job responsibilities.

how.description: Used internal search functions to locate sensitive documents or project names unrelated to assigned tasks.
how.procedure: User browses or searches within document management or file-repository systems for files outside their responsibility area, driven by curiosity rather than explicit malicious intent.
observable_evidence: Search queries by user for project names/data sets outside work scope
Access to directories or document types not typical for user role
High number of view/open events for sensitive documents by a user not usually accessing them
how.impact: Unauthorized access to sensitive data may lead to inadvertent data exposure or violation of confidentiality, even without intent to exfiltrate.

how.description: Sent emails or messages requesting access to files with restricted permissions out of curiosity.
how.procedure: User leverages interpersonal relationships or contacts within the organization to ask for access to restricted files or shares, not necessarily maliciously but outside standard workflow.
observable_evidence: Email or chat message requesting permission for files not needed for assigned tasks
Permission approval logs for accesses requested without business justification
Change-control tickets or request logs for access that are unusual for the role
how.impact: Grants of inappropriate access increase potential for later exposure or misuse of the data.

how.description: Repeatedly accessed and opened multiple internal reports or code files through internal applications without explicit business justification.
how.procedure: User uses their legitimate access to browse, open or download confined reports, code files or internal documents repeatedly, even though they are not part of the userâ€™s role or tasks.
observable_evidence: Frequent file opens/downloads of sensitive documents by the same user over time
Access logs showing user retrieving files they have not accessed before or beyond scope
Large volumes of accessed data from restricted folders by general user
how.impact: Accumulated access to sensitive data may create risk of exposure, accidental leak, or misuse, even if no immediate exfiltration is evident.
